title: Ohio Firm Recalls Chef Salads Containing Meat and Poultry Due to Possible Salmonella Contamination of Tomatoes
summary: WASHINGTON, October 1, 2011 - Greencore USA, Inc., a Cincinnati, Ohio, establishment, is recalling approximately 57 pounds of salad products containing meat and poultry, because the grape tomatoes used in these products may be contaminated with Salmonella, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and...
impacted_products: 5.6 oz. plastic bowl containers of "Thornton's Quick Café's Chef Salad" with an "Enjoy By" date of "09/30/11", "10/02/2011" or "10/03/2011."
